summary: The 'Taliban Rare Earth Minerals Sanctions Act' (H.R. 969) directs the President to impose sanctions on foreign entities that knowingly engage in significant transactions related to the rare earth mineral sector of Afghanistan.  These sanctions include blocking property in the U.S. and denying visas to those involved.  The bill specifically excludes sanctions on the importation of goods. Penalties for violations are detailed, referencing the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.
